text:
The latest buzz from today's market

	
India-US trade deal revised: India-US trade deal factsheet was revised by the White House: mentions of pulses were removed, and India’s $500 billion purchase commitment was softened to an intent, adjusting key terms of the pact. Source: The Economic Times

	
European MNCs to list Indian Units in Mumbai: European multinationals are planning to list their Indian units in Mumbai, eyeing IPOs in sectors like auto parts and clean energy, boosted by India’s vibrant markets and the EU-India trade deal outlook. Source: The Economic Times

	
US wealth management stocks slip on automation fears: US wealth-management stocks slid sharply as traders dumped shares after a new AI-powered tax/advisory tool sparked fears automation could disrupt traditional advisory models. Major firms like Raymond James, Charles Schwab & LPL Financial saw steep drops. Source: The Economic Times

	
Investments in gold, debt, flexi-cap funds go up in Jan: Investors flocked to gold, debt, and flexi-cap funds in January, while equity mutual fund inflows fell ~14%; SIPs stayed strong above ₹31,000 cr amid market volatility. Source: Business Standard

	
Torrent Pharma shares fall; company to issue NCDs: Torrent Power’s shares dropped ~6% after it reported Q3FY26 results showing a 34% rise in net profit and interim dividend declaration, plus a plan to raise funds via NCDs. Source: Business Standards

Lesson of the DaY
Learning from Algo Trading Communities
You’re learning to play a new sport.

Practising alone helps, but real improvement comes when you watch others play, ask questions, and learn from shared mistakes and wins.

You progress faster when you don’t learn in isolation.

Algo trading works the same way.

Learning from communities helps traders exchange ideas, understand common pitfalls, and see how others approach strategy building and risk management. Shared learning often prevents repeatable mistakes.

In the Spotlight
The latest buzz from today's market

	
Textile exporters to get Bangladesh style zero-duty benefits: India’s textile exporters are set to get Bangladesh-style zero-duty benefits on garments made with US cotton, boosting competitiveness in the US market, says Commerce Ministry. Source: The Economic Times

	
RBI’s new draft asks banks to ban dark patterns, ensure clear disclosures, etc: RBI’s new draft rules require banks and financial firms to ban dark patterns, ensure clear disclosures, and give customers a 100% refund if a product was mis-sold, strengthening consumer protection. Source: The Economic Times

	
3.25 lakh crore deal to buy 114 French Rafales sealed: India cleared a historic ₹3.25 lakh crore deal to buy 114 French Rafale fighter jets, boosting the Air Force’s combat strength and defence manufacturing under Make in India. Source: The Economic Times

	
HAL reports 30% YoY profit in Q3: HAL reported a 30% YoY profit rise to ₹1,867 cr in Q3 with revenue up ~11% and declared a ₹35 per share interim dividend, showing strong defence execution. Source: The Economic Times

	
New CPI data shows higher inflation; RBI keep srepo rate unchanges: New CPI data may show higher inflation than before, giving the RBI reason to keep interest rates unchanged instead of cutting them, despite inflation still under target. Source: Business Standards
